intro: Pyrrothrix heterochroa, commonly known as the two-colored pyrrothrix, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its biennial growth habit and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
